channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very large pothole on pavement, 20th August
item.description:
The pothole is on the pavement exactly in front of house 115 Hesters Way Road GL51 0RJ. It has been there for several months and it keeps getting wider, especially when it has been raining.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 113, Hesters Way Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Long grass obstructs view of oncoming traffic., 20th August
item.description:
Turning right off Cirencester Road into Ermin Way, tall grass on central reservation obstructing view of oncoming traffic. This is accentuated by a hump in the road and the bend. There is a likelihood of a head on collision!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The rainwater gully is blocked, causing significant pooling on road, 20th August
item.description:
There are three gullies outside Brook House, Court Road, GL3 4QT. This is the lowest point in the road. They are blocked. Within 5 minutes of heavy rain this morning there was significant flooding across the road, causing vehicles to drive on wrong side of road to avoid. Sadly witnessed two pedestrians get very splashed from a vehicle driving past.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes at the entrance to Meadow way & The Holt Bishops Cleeve, 20th August
item.description:
This road repair has now been necessary for at least 2 Years, whilst other roads around the village are repaired this road remains a disgrace on a link road into a quality housing area ( The Holt) I have sent photos in the past but no response was received.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 20th August
item.description:
The Potholes between my house - Edgehill and Westaway are now so severe that there is danger to road users as vehicles zig zag down the lane to avoid them
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Weeds and vegetation have overgrown along a large area of this footpath and styles making it impossible to navigate, 19th August
item.description:
The problem starts at the kissing gate on Hyde Lane and continues along a large section of this footpath including several of the styles
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Tewkesbury

item.title: All street lights out on Kingsmead road, 19th August
item.description:
From village road to princess Elizabeth way all the street lights are out along Kingsmead road. This was reported before but it's been over 2 weeks that they have been out and now the nights are drawing in it's getting darker earlier. I would like something done asap as nothing is getting done.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead deeron hard shoulder, 19th August
item.description:
Dead deer just before signage for A46 turn off from A417 heading towards Gloucester/ M5 junction 11A Seen on way home from work around 5pm Https://what3words.com/origins.townhouse.ditched
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There are two large potholes just at end of bridge on NW side, 19th August
item.description:
These potholes are a serious risk as cars going towards Swindon Village swerve to miss them - and could crash into oncoming traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 19th August
item.description:
Dear Sir / Madam I am writing to you to complain about a loose or broken man hole cover on the road of Evesham road (after roundabout of junction of Finlay way, bishops cleeve bypass) its at the back of my house that faces the main road as above, and is really noisy when cars or lorry’s run over it. It’s been going on for a while now and have got to a point I can’t take it no more!!! Please could someone come out and investigate or fix it please, my contact number is 07771685387 and my address is 21 Blackberry grove, bishops cleeve, cheltenham Gl528wl Many thanks Dean Williams
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath becoming impassable due to falling trees and vegetation blocking path., 19th August
item.description:
On footpath leading from Cirencester road (opposite old Witcombe Post Office) and leading into Green Lane in Little Witcombe. The problem was apaprently dealt with in last 12 months but tree has since fallen further leading to a gap only about 1 mtere high. General obstructions also cause by large number of bramble brancehes hanging down over path.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large directional signs totally missing, 19th August
item.description:
Large directional signs which are totally missing from the roundabout. Just 2 large posts left leaning in the verge, The signs need to be replaced. Also very badly faded lining on the roundabout. So may near misses from road users not being able to see which lane to be in because the arrows are so faded. This needs to be refreshed asap it is a safety hazard and an accident waiting to happen.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A417, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
